required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of New Custom Made Hearing Product Technology and Shell Modification
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of New Custom Made Hearing Product Technology and Shell Modification

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this evaluation is to receive the greatest benefit of new custom made hearing product technology and shell modification for the end customer and to continual improve the custom made hearing products.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a controlled, single blinded comparative study which is conducted monocentric at Phonak Headquarters in Staefa.
The purpose of the studies is to evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of new custom product development in comparison to existing/old products. The results should promote the custom product development, to provide a maximum of benefit and wearing comfort to the hearing aid user.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective measurement of speech intelligibility related to the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: SNR (speech to noise ratio) in decibel.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective measurement of the transfer function related to the intervention.
Objective measurement from the position of the outer ear related to the test subject.
Objective measurement from the size of the outer ear related to the test subject.
Objective measurement of humidity in the ear canal related to the test subject and the intervention.
Objective measurement of temperature in the ear canal related to the test subject and the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective rating of the intervention via questionnaire.

arm_group.description: In the ear (ITE) hearing aid, 1-3 weeks wearing
In the ear (ITE) hearing aid, 1-3 weeks wearing

intervention.intervention_name: hearing aid (MD class IIa) - ITE, BTE, RIC
intervention.other_name: hearing accessory (MD class I) - DM systems, FM systems, remote control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Only adult participants between 18 and 99 years
- lnformed Consent as documented by signature (Appendix lnformed Consent Form)
- Ability to fill in a questionnaire conscientious
- Healthy outer ear (w/o previous surgical procedures)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications to the MD in this study, e.g. known hypersensitivity or allergy to the investigational product,
- Limited mobility and not in the position to attend weekly appointments
- Limited ability to describe listening impressions/experiences and the use of the hearing aid
- lnability to produce a reliable hearing test result when pure tone audiometry is attempted by the audiologist
- Massively limited dexterity
- Psychological problems
- Central hearing problems

overall_official.affiliation: Switzerland, Sonova AG, CH-8712 Staefa, Zurich
